briefTitle: Efficacy of To Be Marketed (TBM) Cholic Acid Capsules Used to Treat Children With Inborn Errors of Bile Acid Synthesis
conditions: Inborn Errors of Bile Acid Synthesis

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* must have stable transaminase levels within 2 times the upper limits of the normal range.
* must have a diagnosis of an inborn error of bile acid synthesis.
* must have signed the written informed consent/assent document before study start.
* must be currently receiving currently used cholic acid therapy under IND 45,470.
* must be willing and able to comply with all study assessments and procedures.
* must be able to make two visits (Visit 1 and Visit 2) to the study site.

Exclusion Criteria:

* is not currently receiving cholic acid therapy for inborn errors of bile acid synthesis under IND 45,470.
* is unable or unwilling to comply with study requirements.

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum Transaminases
outcomeMeasures.description: Concentration of serum alanine transaminase (ALT) and aspartate transaminase (AST)

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum and Urine Bile Acids
outcomeMeasures.description: Concentration of bile acids in serum (S) and urine (U). (abbreviations: chol.=cholenoic; monohydro=monohydroxy; dihydro=monohydro)

outcomeMeasures.title: Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Total number of patients with any adverse events

outcomeMeasures.title: Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP)

outcomeMeasures.title: Physical Examination
outcomeMeasures.description: Total number of patients with abnormal findings from general physical examination

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Bilirubin
outcomeMeasures.description: Concentration of total bilirubin in serum
